definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: David was dressed like a dude to attend a party last night.
sentences.chinese: 大卫昨天晚上穿得花里花哨去参加一个聚会。

sentences.english: Her house was far nicer before it was all tarted up.
sentences.chinese: 她的房子以前要比花哨地装饰好看得多。

sentences.english: Probably one of the most colorful and abstract 404 error pages out there.
sentences.chinese: 或许是最抽象，最花哨的404页面之一。

sentences.english: Firms also use fancy job titles to signal that they are au fait with the latest fashion.
sentences.chinese: 各家公司用花哨的职位来表示他们紧跟时尚潮流。

sentences.english: Don’t be intimidated by fancy words you cannot pronounce seen on restaurant menus.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为你读不出餐馆菜单上花哨的菜名而胆怯。

sentences.english: Still the JLo-style (Jennifer Lopez) suites in candy colors remain part of this year’s fashion.
sentences.chinese: 花哨时髦的詹妮弗风格的套装也是今年流行的一部分。

sentences.english: Nothing all that fancy today, An ordinary perm will do.
sentences.chinese: 今天不要那么花哨，一般的电烫就行了。

sentences.english: Oh, and less fashion editorials but more news-based features would be nice.
sentences.chinese: 如果时髦花哨的编辑再少点，多加点新闻专题就好了。

sentences.english: Who on earth would want such a splashy dress?
sentences.chinese: 谁会要这么花哨的裙子？

sentences.english: She was wearing a lurid orange and green blouse.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一件花哨的橙绿相间的衬衫。

sentences.english: Some people reserve them for a fancy bookplate .
sentences.chinese: 有些人将它们留作贴花哨的藏书票用。

sentences.english: Too much flashiness in blog design take any from the content.
sentences.chinese: 太过花哨的版面设计并没什么好处。

sentences.english: These patricians don't need gaudy symbols to advertise their wealth.
sentences.chinese: 这些贵族无须通过花哨的物品彰显自己的财富。

sentences.english: It's a really basic application - no bells and whistles here.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个相当基本的应用，没有花哨的东西。

sentences.english: These clothes are too fancy for me, I prefer plainer ones.
sentences.chinese: 这些衣服对我来说有些花哨，我还是喜欢素净些的。

sentences.english: I remember having been shocked in 1976 by the cramped overcrowding of the tawdrier tenements in Kowloon.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得，在一九七六年被九龙的花哨的房屋所震撼。

definition: flower but no fruit (idiom); handsome exterior but hollow inside/flashy
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
